PageTitle: peer connect-interface (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer connect-interface command specifies a source interface from which BGP packets are sent, and a source address used for initiating a connection.
The undo peer connect-interface command restores the default setting. The peer connect-interface command specifies a source interface from which BGP packets are sent, and a source address used for initiating a connection. The undo peer connect-interface command restores the default setting. By default, the outbound interface of a BGP packet serves as the source interface of a BGP packet.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies an IPv4 source address used for establishing a connection.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Running the peer connect-interface command to establish multiple peer relationships between two devices by using multiple links is recommended.
If the physical interface has multiple IP addresses, the parameter ipv4-source-address must be in the command peer connect-interface.
